metadata.synopsis: You have confronted Kagha about being a Shadow Druid. This has initiated the transformation of the rats into shadow druids before your very eyes. The shadow druids welcome the circle into their fold; you have to fight, or convince Kagha to come around, which will be very hard - and even harder if the kid died before. Olodan the shadow druid is their leader; slobbering and sleazy.

58.speaker: Olodan
58.text: Tsk. That damned nose of yours has gone poking in our business.

15.speaker: Olodan
15.text: Shh-shh. No need. It couldn't be helped.

112.speaker: Rath
112.text: Kagha! What is the meaning of this?

80.speaker: Olodan
80.text: You think yourself quite the spy, don't you? Go on - tell him.

6.speaker: Player
6.text: Take this letter, Rath. It will explain everything.

57.speaker: Rath
57.text: What in the... Cloakwood? Kagha - have you lost your mind?!
57.context: NodeContext: Rath takes the letter from you and reads it, below frame. Places in back pocket.

64.speaker: Kagha
64.text: Halsin is weak, Rath. But in the shadows, we are strong, we are safe. There is no other way.

113.speaker: Olodan
113.text: You and Halsin welcome untouchables to your midst.

103.speaker: Olodan
103.text: You defile the grove for the sake of 'harmony'.

3.speaker: Kagha
3.text: Olodan speaks truth. Do you disagree, Rath? You would see this grove in ruin?
3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Calling out to the group. After, |The camera looks at Rath, alone.NodeContext: Calling out to the group

73.speaker: Olodan
73.text: The choice is made. Kagha: burn the tainted away. Start with the snitch.
73.context: CinematicNodeContext: Olodan turns to look at player with a sneer for the second line

110.speaker: Player
110.text: You're so desperate to be proven right - it's made you forget who you really are.

91.speaker: Kagha
91.text: I - yes. When the darkest hour fell, it was us that brought light.

107.speaker: Player
107.text: Can't you feel how the prayer disturbs the soil and air? The grove trembles in fear.

8.speaker: Kagha
8.text: It... it trembles in shame. It knows that in harmony, we perish. In shadow, we are pure.
8.context: NodeContext: Not as confident as before. Voice breaks a little.

22.speaker: Kagha
22.text: The grove may thrive only when the great vine strangles those who imperil it.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: You are druids. You've an oath to uphold nature's harmony, its strength - stand by it.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: Harmony is not weakness - it is balance. Strength. Silvanus calls on you to preserve it.

59.speaker: Kagha
59.text: No! You... you twist the teachings. In harmony, we perish. In shadow, we are pure.
59.context: NodeContext: Not as confident as before. Voice breaks a little.

77.speaker: Narrator
77.text: *Kagha's voice breaks and her lips tremble. She heard reason in your words.*

97.speaker: Player
97.text: Recite the frescoes you have read. Remind Kagha of the grove's legacy.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Recite the frescoes you have read. Instil her with pride in the grove's legacy.
25.context: InternalNodeContext: The player read and understood at least two of the frescos. These frescos are all around them in this area

48.speaker: Kagha
48.text: When... when the darkest hour fell, it was us that brought light.

106.speaker: Kagha
106.text: Silvanus demands we illuminate shadow, not hide within it.

29.speaker: Kagha
29.text: How - how was I so blind?

54.speaker: Olodan
54.text: Careful, Kagha. The shadows don't forgive.

95.speaker: Kagha
95.text: I belong to the shadows no longer. You've no power over me!

61.speaker: Olodan
61.text: You would question my power? Mother Earth, hear me. Grant me your wrath!

40.speaker: Narrator
40.text: *Kagha eyes you intently as you speak the text etched into the frescoes.*

38.speaker: Narrator
38.text:
*'By claw and tooth, from root to thorn,
The Old Oak's grove, to wildlings sworn.'*

12.speaker: Narrator
12.text:
*'The forest rose with claw and tooth
To tear the darkness from its roots.'*

43.speaker: Narrator
43.text:
*'In darkest hour, a concord made,
'Twixt harp and wild against the shade.'*

86.speaker: Narrator
86.text:
*'The towers seized, the battle done,
The moonrise broke the Darkest One.'*

65.speaker: Kagha
65.text: Empty ramblings, all of them. While you obsess over yesterday, I will be making our tomorrow.

104.speaker: Kagha
104.text: I take this grove for the shadows!

87.speaker: Player
87.text: Recite the frescoes you have read. Remind Kagha of the grove's legacy.
87.context: InternalNodeContext: The player read and understood at least two of the frescos. These frescos are all around them in this area

85.speaker: Player
85.text: I know these druids' ways. All they touch is fated to decay.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I know these druids' ways. In their hands, this grove will decay.

90.speaker: Player
90.text: You know I'm right. Don't let the shadows corrupt you.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: The shadows will only corrupt - you don't need them.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: I tried reasoning with you. Looks like it'll take blood to settle this.

98.speaker: Narrator
98.text: *You watch Kagha closely. If she is moved by your plea, she gives no sign.*

70.speaker: Kagha
70.text: Silvanus calls on me to shield the circle, balance be damned.

50.speaker: Kagha
50.text: Olodan, strike. We take this grove for the shadows!

101.speaker: Player
101.text: The shadows won't save you - they'll corrupt you. Stop this, while you can.

46.speaker: Kagha
46.text: No! You... you don't know what you say. In shadow, we are purified.
46.context: NodeContext: Not as confident as before. Voice breaks a little.

39.speaker: Kagha
39.text: The shadows don't corrupt us - they cleanse us.

109.speaker: Kagha
109.text: With the grove taken for Cloakwood, the circle will see that I'm right. The Great Mother will guard us from all danger.

5.speaker: Kagha
5.context: NodeContext: Shakes off the mindprobe attempt

99.speaker: Player
99.text: Take the grove - I won't stand in your way.

102.speaker: Olodan
102.text: Oh, but you already have. Or does my memory fail so completely?

71.speaker: Olodan
71.text: End them, Kagha. Unless you have... lost your nerve.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Sometimes the old must burn for the new to flourish. I won't interfere.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: Spare my life, so I might join the Cloakwood druids.

13.speaker: Olodan
13.text: No one joins the Shadow Druids. Oh, no - their presence is requested.

88.speaker: Olodan
88.text: And I don't recall sending an invitation.

82.speaker: Player
82.text: You seem intent on forcing me to take your life. So be it.

55.speaker: Kagha
55.text: Olodan speaks truth. Who among you disagrees? Who would see this grove in ruin?
55.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The camera looks at Marcoryl, then Loic, and finally Rath.NodeContext: Calling out to the group

72.speaker: Kagha
72.text: Olodan speaks truth. Who among you disagrees? Who would see this grove in ruin?
72.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The camera looks at Marcoryl, then Loic, and finally Rath.NodeContext: Calling out to the group

79.speaker: Kagha
79.text: Olodan speaks truth. Do you disagree? Would you see this grove in ruin?
79.context: CinematicNodeContext: |The camera looks at Marcoryl, then Rath.NodeContext: Calling out to the group

60.speaker: Player
60.text: Kagha's a Shadow Druid. She means to convert the circle.

23.speaker: Rath
23.text: A Shadow Druid? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

74.speaker: Player
74.text: Forget it, rat. You can explain it yourself.

66.speaker: Olodan
66.text: You'd decline the honour? Very well.

21.speaker: Olodan
21.text: Halsin's always welcomed untouchables to your midst. Defiled the grove for the sake of 'harmony'.

34.speaker: Olodan
34.text: We've come from Cloakwood to correct his mistakes.

28.speaker: Rath
28.text: Cloakwood... Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!

114.speaker: Player
114.text: The Shadow Druids are taking over - the circle is overdue some change.

0.speaker: Rath
0.text: Shadow Druids? Kagha, have you lost your mind?!
